description: Masks will no longer be requiring in any of our buildings or locations at Pearl Harbor National Memorial. This alert will be updated again as needed.

description: Opal Beach Complex A restrooms are closed. All others are open. Visit our maps page to download a map of current restroom locations at https://www.nps.gov/guis/planyourvisit/maps.htm.

title: Visitor Center Closed
description: The visitor center is now closed. To request a site tour, call 530-667-8119 at least 2 weeks in advance.

title: House Tours Changes for September 16, 2022
description: Friday, September 16, 2022 there will not be a 10:00 am or 11:00 am tour available. All other tour options are available. Check the Calendar for more information. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Restrooms closed at Haleakalā Visitor Center
description: Restrooms are temporarily closed at the Haleakalā Visitor Center at 9,740 feet. If you are visiting the summit, use the restroom before you head up. Restrooms are available at the Headquarters Visitor Center, Halemauʻu Trailhead, and Kalahaku Overlook.

title: Going-to-the-Sun Road 2022 Season Dates
description: The Going-to-the-Sun Road is fully open to vehicle traffic until October 1, 2022. The G-T-S-R will close on the west side from Apgar to Logan Pass on October 1. The G-T-S-R will remain open from St. Mary to Logan Pass until October 16, weather permitting.

title: Most Boat Ramps Closed- Box Canyon Partially Reopened.
description: Most boat ramps remain closed to launching trailered boats. Currently, open boat ramps for launching trailered boats are Diablo East, Rough Canyon, Spur 454 (no dock). Box Canyon is partially open. For boat ramp status, please click "more>"

title: High Fire Danger is in effect at Point Reyes National Seashore for Thursday, September 8.
description: Under High Fire Danger conditions: All wood fires are prohibited. Previously issued beach fire permits are null & void. No additional fire permits will be issued. Self-contained gas stoves are allowed in campgrounds and picnic areas.

title: Boaters: Small Craft Advisory is in effect from 3 pm on Thu., Sep. 8 until 9 am on Friday, Sep. 9.
description: The Nat. Weather Service has issued a Small Craft Advisory for coastal waters between Point Arena and Point Reyes, including Tomales Bay. Winds of 21–33 knots (24–38 mph) and/or steep waves are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.

title: 2022 Klondike Road Relay 2
description: 09/08/22, Broadway will be closed between 1st & 2nd Ave from 5:00 pm to 1:00 am and Alaska Street will be closed at 23rd Ave from 5:00 pm to 1:00 am! Please be vigilant of runners!

title: Black Bears at Big South Fork
description: Black bears call Big South Fork NRRA home. Help keep them healthy and safe by storing all food, cooking items, feed, cosmetics and coolers properly stored when at campgrounds or in the backcountry.

title: Western National Parks Association Store Closed on Tuesday, September 13th
description: Walnut Canyon's Western National Parks Association Store will be closed on Tuesday, September 13th for inventory. During this time the park store will not be accessible. Visitors can visit the WNPA online store, or the WNPA store at Wupatki.

title: Detour Bay Springs, MS (mp 293) to Colbert Ferry, AL (mp 326)
description: This section of the Parkway is closed for repaving. (Colbert Ferry remains open) Please see the detour map page by clicking "more". The base layer is nearly complete, but the top layer, accesses, etc., are not. Partial completion, is expected in the Fall.

title: Construction Closures
description: After Labor Day until winter the Moose-Wilson Road from the Granite Canyon Entrance to the LSR Preserve will be closed, no access to Granite Canyon Trailhead. Jackson Lake Dam Launch is closed for the fall season, find alt river launch.

title: Lost Mine Trail CLOSED due to storm damage
description: On Saturday, monsoon rains resulted in heavy damage to a series of switchbacks along the Lost Mine Trail. The trail is closed until trail crews can repair the damage and make it safe for hikers. No estimated date for reopening at this time.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement: REQUIRED
description: Consistent with CDC guidance, in areas of substantial or high transmission, visitors to Cumberland Island National Seashore, regardless of vaccination status, are required to wear a mask inside all park buildings. CURRENT STATUS: REQUIRED

title: ALERT: Inner Canyon Water Availability is LIMITED — Thursday, September 8, 2022
description: Water OFF Bright Angel Trail: 1.5 and 3 Mile Resthouses. Water OFF N. Kaibab Trail at Cottonwood, Manzanita. —Phantom Ranch water outside main lodge only. When traveling below the rim, a method to filter or treat water must ALWAYS be part of your gear.

title: What's Closed, and What's Open This Week? - Thursday, September 8, 2022
description: [CDC LOW Community Level] Face Masks Are Not Required this week in either indoor or outdoor locations, and on park shuttle buses, while CDC Community Level remains either low or medium. What's closed and what's open this week?

title: Excessive Heat Warning — Inner Canyon High Temp of 110°F (43 °C) 9/8/2022
description: Hike into the canyon before 10 am and/or after 4 pm. Avoid midday heat. Bring: Water & Electrolytes - Food & Salty Snacks - Sunscreen - Sunglasses - Loose, Protective Clothing - and Wide-brimmed Hat. Bring a way to filter or purify water from creeks.

title: Chilkoot Trail Reopened After Completion of Pat Moore Suspension Bridge Repairs
description: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park has repaired the Pat Moore Suspension Bridge. The bridge and trail are now open north of Pleasant Camp

title: Boil Water Notice at Furnace Creek Campground
description: If you are planning to camp, please be advised there is a boil water notice in effect for Furnace Creek Campground.

title: Fire Restrictions Are In Effect
description: A fire ban is in effect for both units of Theodore Roosevelt National Park due to dry conditions. Campfires are not allowed at this time. Gas stoves allowed in campgrounds, picnic areas, and backcountry areas where no combustible materials are present.

title: Area Closures for the Quartz and North Camas Fires
description: The areas, campgrounds, and trails within Quartz Lake drainage from the Continental Divide to the Inside North Fork Road are closed for the Quartz Fire. The Camas Creek trail is closed above Arrow Lake for the North Camas Fire.

title: Early Closures of Mississippi River Visitor Center
description: On Friday, September 9th and Saturday, September 10th, the Mississippi River Visitor Center (inside the Science Museum of Minnesota) in St. Paul will close early at 5 p.m. instead of 8 p.m.

title: East Fork Quinault Trail Closed to Stock
description: Due to repairs on the Pony Bridge, it will be impassable to stock. The trail will be closed to stock from September 14, 2022 until repairs are completed in the spring. Hikers will still be able to pass until the final stage of repairs.

title: Phone Lines Down
description: We are unable to receive calls at this time. Please email us at bisc_information@nps.gov, visit our social media sites, or search the website for more information. You can still contact Biscayne National Park Institute for boat tours at (786) 465-4058.

title: Masks Required
description: Due to the high levels of transmission in Miami Dade County, masks are currently required in all indoor spaces of Biscayne National Park.

title: Boater Awareness
description: Please use caution in park waters due to navigational markers that may be missing or moved due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: Spare the Air Alert in Effect Through Thursday, September 8
description: No recreational fires are permitted at park (including campfires, beach fires, and outdoor grills) during Spare the Air days. See Fire Information webpage for details.

description: No recreational fires are permitted at park (including campfires, beach fires, and outdoor grills) during Spare the Air days. See Fire Information webpage for details.

description: For trail and camp closures due to fire activity in the Chilliwack Complex visit the Trail Conditions page.

title: Park Store Closed for Inventory September 8th
description: The Western National Parks Association Bookstore, located at the Golden Spike Visitor Center, will be closed tomorrow for inventory. We apologize for this inconvenience. All other features in the visitor center will be available to the public.

title: September 24th: No Short Train Rides
description: Due to crew availability, there will be NO short train rides on Saturday, September 24th, only the excursion to Carbondale. The Scranton Limited Yard Shuttle will be available on Friday, September 23rd and Sunday, September 25th.

title: Some Primitive Roads CLOSED
description: Prolonged rainfall has caused many unpaved roads to become impassable. Current closures include: River Rd, Old Maverick Rd, Glenn Springs Rd (past Pine Cyn), Juniper Canyon Rd, and Hot Springs Rd.

title: Window Trailhead CLOSED at campgrounds
description: The trailheads for the Window Trail in the Basin Campground and Basin Group Campground are CLOSED until further notice. The Window Trail remains OPEN, and accessible from the main trailhead in the Chisos Basin.

title: Chisos Basin Campground Temporarily CLOSED until 9-12-22
description: The Chisos Basin Campground and Chisos Basin Group Campground are closed to public use due to significantly increased bear activity in the campground area. Campground will reopen on Monday, September 12. All trails in the Chisos remain open

title: Scheduled closure of Shafer Trail Road weekdays Oct 24 through Nov 10
description: The unpaved Shafer Trail Road will close for routine maintenance on weekdays October 24 through November 10th. The road may reopen for weekend use Oct 29-30 and Nov 5-6. This project will repair tread surfaces and shoulders damaged by recent rains.

title: Altered Schedule During Eugene O'Neill Festival
description: From September 10th through the 25th, park tour schedules will be limited due to the Eugene O'Neill Festival. There will be NO tours on Saturdays. Open Saturdays will resume on 10/1/22.

title: Whittington Cold Spring Temporarily Out of Service
description: From Sept. 7th through Friday, Sept. 9th, the cold spring water jug fountain located on Whittington Ave. will be temporarily out of service for maintenance upgrades. The Happy Hollow cold spring water jug fountain is still open.

title: Partial Trail Closure For Work Crews
description: Work crews will be backfilling several rooms with dirt using a tractor in order to help with erosion and preserving the walls. This will occur on the east side of the monument. That portion of the trail will be closed while work is being complete.

title: Construction Near Mora Campground
description: Due to a restoration project on the Quillayute River, visitors to the Mora Campground can expect to hear significant construction noise 7 days a week through October 2022. Work hours are 8 am-6 pm (north side of the river) and 8 am-sunset (south side).

title: Museum Exhibits Closed
description: The museum exhibit gallery will be closed on a rolling basis for cleaning and repairs. We apologize for any inconveniences.

title: Park Film and Store Closed 9/21/22
description: The park film and store will be closed all day on 9/21/22. The museum will remain open for access from 8:30 until 4:00 and staff will be stationed outside to greet visitors and provide information.

title: Zion-Mount Carmel Highway closed 9 p.m. to 6 a.m.
description: The Zion-Mt. Carmel Highway will close for roadwork from Canyon Junction to the park's East Entrance from 9 p.m. - 6 a.m. on the nights of Wednesday, September 7 and Thursday, September 8. The road will be open during the day. No through travel at night

title: Ajo Mountain Drive Closed For Construction Starting September 6th, 2022
description: Ajo Mountain Drive will close starting September 6th and will remain closed until further notice for a road improvement construction project.

title: Prescribed Pile Burn
description: Fort Davis National Historic Site and Big Bend National Park Fire Managers will be having a prescribed pile burn at 11:00am 9/7/2022. For firefighters and visitors safety there will be NO Public Hiking allowed on the maintenance road up Hospital Canyon.

title: Heat Advisory is in effect until 8 pm on Thursday, September 8.
description: The NWS has issued a Heat Advisory for the Marin Coastal Range, including parts of Bolinas Ridge. Stay hydrated. Know signs/symptoms of heat illnesses. Never leave children, pets, the elderly, or disabled in vehicles for any length of time.

title: East Rim Drive Will Close to Motor Vehicles for the Annual "Ride the Rim" Bicycling Event
description: On Fri, Sept 9 at 8 pm til 6 pm on Sat Sept. 10 & on Fri, Sept 16 at 8 pm til 6 pm on Sat, Sept 17, East Rim Drive and Pinnacles Road (including viewpoints and hiking trails) will be closed to motor vehicles. All other roads (& trails) are open to all.

title: Park Headquarters Phone Down
description: Until this alert is rescinded, the phone at the park headquarters visitor center is down. The phones at Quarai (505-847-2290), Abó (505-847-2400), and Gran Quivira (505-847-2770) are working properly. Please direct all phone inquiries to any of the sites.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
description: Due to San Juan County's HIGH transmission rate, masks are required in all NPS buildings in Canyonlands regardless of vaccination status.

title: Road Closure on State Route 211 -- Detour to The Needles
description: SR-211 is closed to all traffic at Hwy 191 junction. Visitors may access The Needles from a detour. From Hwy 191 in Monticello, turn West onto 200 S. Continue 18 miles of windy mountain road (not recommended for trailers) to rejoin 211 past the closure.

title: Cades Cove Loop Road Closure on 9/8/22
description: Cades Cove Loop Road will be closed on Thursday, September 8, until 3:30 PM to accommodate the Congressional Medal of Honor event. The closure will go into effect Wednesday evening.

title: Water Hazards Still Present
description: Despite increasing water levels, underwater hazards are still present in the lake. Please be extra vigilant for potential damage to boat or other injury.

title: Ross Maxwell Scenic Drive CLOSED past Mule Ears Overlook
description: High water and debris from heavy rains have damaged the Ross Maxwell Scenic Drive south of Mule Ears Overlook. The scenic drive is currently CLOSED at that point until road crews can repair the damage and make it safe for vehicle traffic.

title: Clingmans Dome Road Closure on 9/7/22
description: Clingmans Dome Road will be closed Wednesday morning, September 7th, until 1:00 PM to facilitate a special curriculum-based education program. The closure will go into effect on Tuesday evening.

title: Bull Elk Are Extremely Dangerous
description: Be alert, especially this time of year around Mammoth Hot Springs. Elk run quickly, and may change direction without warning. You must remain at least 25 yards from all wildlife. If an elk charges, retreat!

title: Mountain Lion Activity Closure
description: The Fruita Campground Amphitheater and the Fremont River Trail from B Loop of the campground through the end of the trail are closed until further notice due to recent mountain lion activity.

title: Fire Ban remains in Effect
description: Fire danger remains high in Southern Oregon, thus a fire ban is in effect for Crater Lake National Park. Wood and charcoal fires are not allowed anywhere in the park. Click the link for all the restrictions regarding campfires, smoking, and fireworks.

title: Obstruction Point Road closed
description: Obstruction Point Road is closed for repairs beginning September 6, 2022. This closure will last until the end of the season.

title: Visitor Center Closed Weekends. Camping & Boating Permits May Be Purchased at Machines.
description: The Visitor Center is open Monday-Friday and closed Saturdays and Sundays. Camping and boating permits may be purchased on location from Ventek machines. Hunting permits may be purchased online (please allow up to 2 weeks to process, see link below.)

title: Excessive Heat Warning in Place
description: The National Weather Service issued an excessive heat warning for the Sierra Nevada foothills until 8:00 pm Friday. This affects lower elevations of Sequoia National Park. If you plan to visit or camp in the foothills area, be prepared for hot weather.

title: Stevens Canyon Road is closed Monday-Thursday from Stevens Creek to Box Canyon.
description: Stevens Canyon Road is closed between Stevens Creek and Box Canyon starting at 6:00 am each Monday through 8:00 pm each Thursday. During the closures, Box Canyon is only accessible from the east side (SR123/Stevens Canyon Entrance).

title: Glade Creek Road and Campground closed on September 7-8
description: Glade Creek Road will be closed just past Grandview Sandbar Campground starting on the evening of September 6. It is intended to be reopened by the morning of September 9. Glade Creek Campground and Glade Creek Trail will be inaccessible during this time.

title: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site visitor center closures - September 2022
description: The Central High School NHS Visitor Center is open Tuesday through Saturday (10:00 a.m. CST/CDT to 4:00 p.m. CST/CDT). Guests may visit the NHS daily; use the NPS App for digital content on days when the visitor center is closed.

title: Lifeguards not on duty after Labor Day
description: Lifeguards will not be on duty after Labor Day at Sandy Hook, Jacob Riis and Great Kills Park. Swimming is prohibited when lifeguards are not on duty.

title: Jacob Riis Park Bays 3-5 closed to beach access
description: Jacob Riis Park Bays 3-5:Closed to beach access due to unsafe conditions from severe erosion.

title: Mask Status in Site Buildings (NHS Visitor Center) - MASKS OPTIONAL - Week of September 4, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance to align with the CDC's new COVID-19 Community Levels tool, which helps communities decide what prevention steps to take. Each Monday, Central High School NHS will update the mask status here for the week ahead.

title: Masks Required in Visitor Center - week of September 4, 2022
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas at a MEDIUM COVID-19 community level, masks are optional for visitors to Little Rock Central High School NHS, regardless of vaccination status, inside all park buildings.

title: Esch Road Closure
description: Esch Road west of M-22 is closed until further notice. Benzie County is reconstructing the road. Access the Otter Creek Loop section of the Platte Plains Trail via Trails End Road. Visit Peterson Beach for beach access.

title: Ironman Triathlon: Sunday, September 11, 2022
description: The race takes place on M-22 and will have a significant impact on local traffic. M-22 will be closed between Esch road and Frankfort until 2 PM. Lake Michigan Road will not be accessible.

title: Visitor Centers closed for the season
description: Both the Exit Glacier Nature Center and the Visitor Center in the Seward Small Boat Harbor are closed for the season. They will reopen in spring 2023

title: Public Closure of East Anacapa Island
description: East Anacapa Island including the campground will be closed for dock construction starting February 2022. Construction is expected to last ten months but may take longer due to the challenges of offshore construction projects.

title: Visiting Requirements Updated September 6, 2022
description: Masks are not required for entry, but you may choose to wear one. Entrance to Independence Hall is by tour only; timed entry tickets are required from 9AM to 5PM.

title: Fort Donelson NB Park Access
description: Visitor Access to Fort Donelson NB Park Lands: Pedestrian Access is from sunrise to sunset. Automobile Access to Fort Donelson NB Park Roads 8:00 am – 6:00 p.m. daily.

title: Fall 2022 Operating Hours for Visitor Center and Museum
description: The Visitor Center and Museum is open 5-days (Wednesday-Sunday). Operating hours are 9:00 am to 5:00 pm. The grounds (including all trails) at Camp Nelson National Monument are open 7-days a week, sunrise to sunset.

title: 4th Grade Passes Temporarily Unavailable
description: Our stock of free America The Beautiful - Every Kid Outdoors 4th Grade Passes has run out. We expect more soon. In the meantime, please contact other parks or order yours online.

title: Park buildings hours change September 4th
description: Beginning September 4, 2022, hours for park buildings will change--the Washington's Headquarters Musuem and the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center will be open Thursday-Sunday 10 AM to 4 PM. For more information, call 973 539 2016 x210

title: Face masks are required indoors at the Chalmette Battlefield Visitor Center.
description: Consistent with CDC guidance, visitors to these visitor centers are now required to wear a mask indoors, regardless of vaccination status, due to the current high COVID transmission rates: Chalmette, Barataria, & Acadian Cultural Center in Lafayette.

title: Trail and Camp Closures for Lightning Creek Trail Area of Ross Lake
description: Lightning Creek Trail between Lightning Creek and Nightmare camps is closed due to fire activity in the area. Camp closures include Deer Lick and Nightmare camps.

title: Plains High School Visitor Center and Museum, Jimmy Carter Boyhood Farm, and Plains Depot are open.
description: Due to decreased levels of transmission, the CDC has recently lowered the COVID-19 Community Levels for Sumter County to “Low”. Masks are not required in NPS buildings.

title: COVID-19 Update: Masks Optional
description: The park is open, including the visitor center, trails, waterways, and day-use areas. Masks are optional. See COVID-19 status page for more info.

title: Hilina Pali Overlook is closed to vehicles
description: Hilina Pali Overlook is closed to vehicles due to high fire danger, but open for pedestrians and bicycles.

title: Rincon Mountain Visitor Center Closed for Visitor Improvements 9/12-9/15
description: The Rincon Mountain Visitor Center will be closed 9/12/22-9/14/22. Building will be open with limited services on 9/15/22. Park maps, bathrooms, and water are available outside of the building but book store will be closed. Thank you for your patience.

title: Race Point Restrooms and Shower CLOSED
description: Restrooms and showers at Race Point Beach are closed. Portable toilets are available.

title: No dock access to Rainbow Bridge Trail
description: No dock access to the shoreline at Rainbow Bridge due to low water. Boats and small vessels beach at your own risk. Houseboats are too large to navigate the canyon. There are no services on the dock, which has been moved out of the way.

title: Newton B Drury Scenic Parkway: Hike and Bike Events
description: On the first Saturday of each winter month (Oct to May), the Scenic Parkway becomes a family (and pets-on-leash) friendly hike and bike experience. Parkway will be closed to motorized vehicles on Friday nights and will reopen Sunday mornings.

title: Your GPS Is Wrong
description: DO NOT use "Bald Hills Road" or "Tall Trees Grove" to drive to Redwood National Park. Most digital maps and apps (yes, including the one you love) do not have accurate information in this area. Our website/mobile app has good directions to get here.

title: Fern Canyon Parking: Summer Permits
description: From May 1 - Sept 30 timed entry permits are required to park at Fern Canyon. These free permits must be applied for online ahead of time.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – MASKS REQUIRED – Week of September 2 - September 9, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance to align with the CDC’s new COVID-19 Community Levels tool, which helps communities decide what prevention steps to take. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status here for the upcoming week.

title: Masks Required
description: Masks are currently required as Custer County is at a high transmission level for COVID-19.

title: Seawall Trail Closure - Effective September 10th
description: The Seawall Trail will be closed on September 10, 2022 to ensure public safety during the park's Defenders' Day event. The trail will reopen on September 11th.

title: COVID-19 Mask-wearing Requirements
description: Benton County's prevalence is low. Guidance, "Employees, volunteers, contractors and visitors at DOI facilities located in counties designated by the CDC as having low or medium community spread are no longer required to use face masks while indoors"

title: North Loop of Horse trail Temporarily Closed
description: The North Loop of the horse trail is closed due to construction work happen in and around the parts of the North Horse Trail Loop.

title: Park Tour Road Construction
description: Construction work continues on the parks diving tour road and parking lots. The replacement of all existing pavement, roads, and sidewalks is still ongoing. Please use caution around the construction work.

title: Face masks are not required.
description: Community transmission level is currently at LOW or MEDIUM: Mask wearing is not required for staff, visitors, or others, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Road Closures
description: Due to flash flood damage, Geology Tour Road (from the northern gate to Berdoo Canyon) is temporarily closed.

title: Masks Optional in Park Buildings
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding medium transmission areas, masks are optional in Mill Springs Battlefield National Monument buildings. Those with symptoms, a positive test, or exposure to someone with COVID-19 should wear a mask.

title: Visitor Center Closed - No Air Conditioning
description: The visitor center is closed is closed until the air conditioning in fixed. This includes the the bookstore. Rangers will be staffing information trailer.

title: Face masks optional: September 2, 2022 Status Update
description: The NPS updated its masking guidance based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Steamtown NHS currently resides in a "MEDIUM" COVID-19 community level area. Masks are optional indoors and on passenger coaches.

title: ParkStore closed 9am-1pm on Friday, September 9 to conduct physical inventory
description: The Western National Parks Association (WNPA) ParkStore (gift shop) will open after the inventory is completed. The anticipated opening time is 1:00 pm. The Information Center will operate under normal business hours, 8:30 am to 4:30 pm.

title: Temporary Phone Number for Visitor Information
description: The park's information phone is experiencing issues. Please dial 651-290-3902 or send us an email for park information.

title: 08/25/2022 Gifford Dump Station Out of Order
description: The Gifford Campground RV dump station is out of order until further notice. Staff are working to get it repaired as quickly as possible.

title: Visitor Center and Bookstore Closed September 8, 2022
description: Our cooperating association, WNPA, will be conducting their annual inventory on Sept. 8 and the visitor center and bookstore will be closed. Park staff will still be available outside the visitor center during normal operations 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

title: Travel Delays - WSDOT State Route 20 Projects and Repairs
description: Numerous emergency repairs and maintenance projects will affect travel times through the park complex along State Route 20. Visitors should expect delays.

title: Black Canyon Campground Closed for the Season Effective 8/30/22
description: The Black Canyon campground is now closed and the docks have been removed due to aggressive bear behavior. This behavior is caused by the bears receiving food rewards from campers over the course of the year. Please use caution while recreating this fall.

title: Road Closures and Construction on US Hwy 50 EAST of the Park
description: New construction schedule for Hwy 50 (east of Hwy 347, between mile posts 123-127) starts July 5: Single-lane alternating traffic M-F 6:30a-7:30p; expect delays. Weekday nights: FULL CLOSURE. Click on "more" for full schedule.

title: Little Bighorn Battlefield will be going to a Cashless Fee Collection November 1, 2022
description: Little Bighorn Battlefield National Monument intends to move to a fully cashless fee system and only accept credit card, debit card, mobile or electronic payments for entrance and permit fees by November 1, 2022.

title: Julian Price Park Loop Closure
description: Due to a utility system failure at JPP Campground, the shower house, dump station, and all campsites in Loops B, C, D, E and F are closed through 9/11/22. Loop A remains open. The dump station as well as campsites in Loops E&F will reopen 9/12/22 at noon

title: Road Closures Near Upper St. Anthony Falls Visitor Center
description: Due to recent street closures near Upper St. Anthony Falls Lock and Dam, drivers should approach the area via West River Pkwy. Accurate information on the Minneapolis Road Closures map may be subject to unreported closures. Extra travel time is advised.

title: Weeklong Closure of Mississippi River Visitor Center
description: The Mississippi River Visitor Center will close from September 12th through 16th, 2022. The closure is for annual building maintenance at the Science Museum of Minnesota.

title: Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed, Shuttle Available Thur-Sun Sept 2-Oct 30
description: The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. During the closure, visitors must walk an additional 0.4 mile around Front Lake, and then 1/3 mile up a hill to the Sandburg Home and farm. A shuttle is available Thurs-Sun, Sep 2 - Oct 30.

title: Face masks required indoors in high COVID transmission counties
description: The park spans Cuyahoga and Summit Counties in Ohio. If county transmission levels are high, masks are required inside Canal Exploration Center (Cuyahoga County), and/or Boston Mill Visitor Center (Summit County).

title: Park Film Will Not be Shown on Wednesday, September 7th, 2022.
description: Park film inside the Mission San José Visitor Center will not be available on Wednesday, 9/7 due to staff training. Park film showings will resume as normal on 9/8 at 10am.

title: Road Construction Sept. 6 - 13
description: From Tuesday, September 6 through Tuesday, September 13, there will be road construction at the park's Fort Gilmer, Fort Harrison, and Beaver Dam Creek sites. Roads will not be closed but be aware of construction workers and materials.

title: Summer 2022 Park Paving Project
description: The main park road, turnouts, and side roads will be paved the summer of 2022. Please expect delays of up to 30 minutes. Work will start in June and continue into early fall. Please watch for temporary closures and reduced speeds.

title: Phase 3 of Cayuse Cove Stabilization Project begins 09/07/2022
description: Beginning 09/07/2022 until the Memorial Day weekend the gravel parking lot and part of the paved boat launch at Porcupine Bay will be closed. Bureau of Reclamation is using these areas to load materials for a stabilization project upstream.

title: GPS Unreliable
description: Be aware that many GPS and app mapping services do not work well within this remote area. Some services may recommend incorrect/dangerous roads and itineraries. Be prepared to use paper maps to navigate

title: Santa Elena Canyon Trail CLOSED
description: High water levels on the Rio Grande and Terlingua Creek have made the trail muddy and impassable. The trail and parking lot for Santa Elena Canyon are currently CLOSED until further notice.

title: Park and campground closed due until Further Notice
description: Greenbelt Park is temporarily closed until Further Notice for visitor safety. The park has trees down throughout the park trails and the campground has a water main leak.

title: Harmful Algae Blooms in Park Lakes and Rivers
description: There have been confirmed reports of algal mats in park lakes and rivers. These may pose a risk to humans and dogs. If you see algae, do not disturb it. Find another area to swim or wade.

title: Masks are Optional in Park Buildings
description: Mask requirements in park buildings are based on CDC COVID-19 community levels. Tulare County is now at the medium level and masks are now optional in all NPS buildings.

title: Post-Labor Day Schedule Update: Tours
description: Starting Tuesday, September 6th, a free public walking tour will be offered at 2:00 PM. School and group programs will be available by reservation at 10:00 AM. Self-guided walking tours are available. Click "more" for additional details.

title: September 11th: No Short Train Rides
description: Due to mandatory training exercises for our volunteers, there will be NO short train rides on Sunday, September 11th. The Scranton Limited Yard Shuttle will be available on Friday, September 9th and Saturday, September 10th.

title: South Puerto Blanco Road Open; West and East Border Roads closed for public safety
description: The border roads (the dirt roads directly along the border) remain closed to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety.

title: Temporary Closure of Chubb Hollow, including pavilion, group sites and trail access
description: A temporary closure of the Chubb Hollow area, including pavilion, group camping sites and trail access is in effect. This closure is due to renovation of the area in conjunction with the Big Spring Lodge and Cabins project.

title: Fee machine at Guy Sandy boat launch out of order
description: The fee machine at the Guy Sandy Boat Launch is out of order. Please purchase boat launch day permits at The Point or Buckhorn fee machines. Annual boat launch permits may be purchased at The Point, Buckhorn, and the Travertine Nature Center.

title: Gulph Rd Closed Between National Memorial Arch and Thomas Rd
description: Gulph Road is closed between the National Memorial Arch and Thomas Road. The cobblestone area, the Encampment Tour route, and all points of interest along the tour remain open.

title: Partial Closure of Visitor Center 9/6 and 9/15-17
description: On 9/6, and 9/15-17, a portion of the visitor center and exhibit area will be closed for installation of a new exhibit element. The rest of the visitor center, exhibits, Foundation store, and Memorial Garden will be open.

title: Smoke from Wildfires May Affect Air Quality
description: Smoke and hazy skies from wildfires continue to plague the Pacific Northwest. Air quality may vary between Good to Moderate and Unhealthy. People with respiratory problems should limit outdoor activity and consult a physician if necessary.

title: Water Low at Some Backcountry Sites
description: Water is low at Halapē and may be low at other backcountry sites. Hikers to Halapē should expect to pack in all water needed for the duration of your trip. Call the Backcountry Office for updates: 808-985-6178

title: Chaco Road Update: 8/29/22
description: The North road (CR 7950) has dried and was graded today. The South road (HWY 57) is also dry and passable. Visitors may enter and exit the park from either road. Please drive carefully on both.

title: Expect long lines to enter the park
description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

title: Road improvements underway
description: Road improvements are taking place on VC02 between the Cabin District and History Grove from 8/29 to 9/2. The road will be open for one-way traffic with flaggers directing traffic during this time. Visitors can expect possible delays.

title: Trail to Hot Springs CLOSED
description: Recent river flooding has damaged the trail to the Hot Springs, and the Hot Springs are filled with sediment. The historic area and upper trail remain open, but the riverside trail to the springs is closed until further notice.

title: Heat Advisory
description: Please, when visiting the park that you bring a water bottle for each person in your group and you can refill them at our new water bottle filling fountains that are located throughout the park! Lightweight clothing and a hat would be good choices.

title: Mask update as of August 29, 2022
description: COVID-19 Mask Requirement Consistent with CDC guidance NYC is considered medium risk. Masks are optional inside buildings

title: The Visitor Center is closed due to upcoming construction projects through Spring of 2023
description: The National Park Service is imposing a temporary closure to the Great Falls Visitor Center through March 5, 2023 due to needed construction projects. The waterfall overlooks, park trails, and restrooms are open. Separate alerts posted if status changes.

title: Covid-19 Information
description: Norfolk County is currently LOW (green) for community transmission, based on the CDC's COVID-19 Community Levels tool. At this time, masks are not required in park buildings. Park staff and visitors may chose to wear masks at their own discretion.

title: Planetarium closed
description: The Nature Center, restrooms at the Nature Center and bookstore are open. However, the Planetarium and Auditorium at the Nature Center must remain closed at this time.

title: Georgetown Waterfront Park fountain currently off
description: The splash fountain at Georgetown Waterfront Park is not working. There is a problem somewhere on the main line that needs to be addressed by DC Water.

title: White Rim Road conditions affected by recent thunderstorms
description: Due to recent heavy rain, exercise caution and expect more difficult than normal driving conditions on the west side of the White Rim Road; including washouts, deep water and mud, and rock fall.

title: Museum Renovations Planned
description: The museum wing of the E.E. Fogelson Visitor Center will close on November 7, 2022. It will remain closed through for renovation project that will install new exhibits. Expected reopening is Spring 2023.

title: Reds Meadow Road, which provides access to Devils Postpile, will close for the season October 11
description: Reds Meadow Road will close on October 11 (with 30-minute delays possible from October 1 through October 11). Shuttle service will end on September 5.

title: Current Visiting Requirements
description: Park grounds, trails, and buildings are open. Masks are not currently required, but visitors may choose to wear them. Tours of the Roosevelt Home are by advanced reservation only. The Old Orchard Museum is open Thursday - Sunday from 11:00 am - 4:00 pm.

title: COVID-19 Update: Masks optional within federal buildings.
description: The CDC has recently lowered the COVID-19 Community Levels for Suffolk County to “Medium”. In accordance with the NPS’s masking guidance policy, masks are now optional inside all federal buildings regardless of vaccination status.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – MASKS REQUIRED – Week of August 26 - September 5, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its mask guidance to align with the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status for the upcoming week. This park spans 2 counties and will follow guidance for the county with higher levels.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – MASKS REQUIRED - starting August 27
description: Consistent with CDC guidance, face coverings are not required in federal buildings at Low or Medium COVID rates. During High COVID rates masks will be required.

title: Enderts Beach Road: September Delays and Temporary October Closure
description: From Sept 1 - Nov 30, expect one-lane traffic and 15 min delays on Enderts Beach Road south of Crescent Beach Day Use Area. A full (24/7) road closure beyond Crescent Beach Day Use Area will occur Sept 8-Oct 15. This is for culvert and road repairs.

title: All Primary Roads and Park facilities CLOSED due to Flash Flood Damage
description: As of 7 am on August 26th, a series of intense rainfall events caused flooding and road damage in many areas of the preserve. All major roads, campgrounds, and visitor centers are currently CLOSED.

title: Riprap Boundary Access Closure
description: Public access to the Riprap trail system at the park boundary via Wild Turkey Lane is no longer available due to private landowner concerns. Please use Skyline Drive to access this trail system.

title: Paving Construction along Shark Valley Tram Road
description: For several weeks beginning Monday August 29, crews will be patching areas along the Shark Valley Tram Road. While the area will remain open, portions of the road may be closed during construction and access to the entire loop may be limited.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of substantial or high transmission, visitors to Camp Nelson National Monument, regardless of vaccination status, are required to wear a mask inside all park buildings.

title: Observation Deck Tours
description: Tours to the Observation Deck have resumed. If you want to go to the Observation Deck you must buy your ticket in the Visitor Center. (Tickets can sell out by 2:00 pm.) (Updated 8/26/2022)

title: Masks are now optional at all Thomas Edison Historical Park buildings
description: As of August 25th, 2022, Essex County New Jersey has become an area of Low risk and Transmission. As such, Thomas Edison NHP no longer requires our visitors to wear masks indoors.

title: COVID-19 Response
description: Consistent with CDC guidance, face coverings are required at Andersonville National Historic Site and in federal buildings in areas with High COVID rates. All signage and alerts will be updated as case rates increase or decrease

title: COVID-19 Mask Guidance - Masks Optional
description: Masks are currently optional inside National Park Service buildings at Dinosaur National Monument, including the Quarry Visitor Center and the Quarry Exhibit Hall per CDC guidance while the Covid-19 Community Level is low in Uintah County, Utah.

title: Masks optional in Dare County facilities and required in Hyde County facilities
description: Based on CDC's COVID-19 Community Level tool, & consistent w/direction from Department of the Interior, masks are optional within indoor federal facilities in Dare County and required within federal indoor facilities in Hyde County.

title: Wood and Charcoal Fires (BBQs) Prohibited Outside of Developed Campgrounds
description: All wood campfires and charcoal fires are prohibited unless they are within approved metal fire containers in the developed campsites of Hole-in-The-Wall, Black Canyon Group, Mid Hills, and Kelso Dunes camping areas. Backcountry fires are PROHIBITIED

title: Graves Creek Road Closed for Repairs, 9/12-13
description: Graves Creek Road will be closed to all vehicle traffic, Sept 12-13, 2022. The closure is necessary to perform critical road repairs (following storm damage from last winter) before future storms and high water events make such repairs impossible.

title: Earth Lodge temporarily closed to protect visitors and wildlife.
description: A few bats recently began roosting in the observation room inside the Earth Lodge. To protect both the bats and park visitors, the Earth Lodge is temporarily closed while staff attempt to completely seal the areas where bats are entering.

title: Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage
description: Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown at this time when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. (8/21/22)

title: Lava Point Overlook closed. Campground open.
description: The Lava Point Overlook is closed for planned maintenance to replace a railing. Please do not enter the area signed as closed. The work does not affect the Lava Point Campground. Work is scheduled to be done in early-fall.

title: Mask Policy - August 22nd, 2022
description: Due to a decrease in cases in Contra Costa County, masks are optional for guests or staff inside park buildings. However, guests are still required to wear masks in multi-passenger government vehicles.

title: Mask Policy - August 22nd, 2022
description: Due to a decrease in cases in Contra Costa County, masks are optional for guests or staff inside park buildings. However, guests are still required to wear masks in multi-passenger government vehicles.

title: Park Central Road Closures
description: Portions of Park Central Road will be closed 7am-3pm Monday through Friday, August 29-September 9, so road shoulders can be mowed and maintenance can be performed. Call the Visitor Center at (301) 663-9388 for details.

title: Road Construction on Route 77/Foxville Road
description: Maryland Department of Transportation State Highway Administration (MDOT SHA) is improving the road surface on Route 77, visitors may encounter delays or single-lane usage west of Catoctin Hollow Road, Mondays-Fridays 8am-4pm, late August through October.

title: Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed
description: El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.

title: Road Work on South Puerto Blanco, Pozo Nuevo and Bates Well Roads via Darby Well.
description: Road crews with heavy equipment will be working on the South Puerto Blanco to Pozo Road then north to Bates Well Road via Darby Well Road. Use caution, drive slow, and follow instructions from road crews when directed to pass.

title: COVID-19: Face Masks Optional
description: Consistent with CDC community level guidance, face masks are currently optional for visitors to Carlsbad Caverns National Park inside all park buildings and the cavern. Please check this site before visiting due to possible community level changes.

title: Internet and Phone Outage
description: The park is currently experiencing a total outage of internet (including email) and phone services. No further information about when service will be restored is available at this time.

title: COVID-19 Alert
description: Chatham County is currently in a state of Low COVID-19 transmission, so masks are optional at the park.

title: Bookstore closed on September 7, 2022
description: Our cooperating association, WNPA, will be conducting their annual inventory on Sept. 7 and the bookstore will be closed. The visitor center exhibits and park staff will still be available during normal operations 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

title: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace Reopens to the Public
description: On Wednesday, 8/24/2022, Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace reopens for public viewing with a modified tour schedule. In observance of COVID protocol, visitors are asked to wear masks and observe social distancing when required.

title: Memorial Column Hours
description: With students headed back to school & visitation patterns changing our operations will be changing. Starting August 30 the Observation Deck will not be available for tours on Tuesdays & Wednesdays. Visitor Center is unaffected by the change.

title: East Beach Temporary Partial Lot Closure Starting August 19
description: Temporary closure for turf restoration project east of restrooms. Area will be closed for a month to allow turf to recover. Stay out of work site & obey traffic cones. See map on Twitter at GGNRANPSAlerts.

title: Beauty Cave and Boy Scout Cave are Closed
description: Beauty Cave and Boy Scout Cave are closed to protect bats and because of environmental conditions. Indian Tunnel and Dewdrop Cave are open and cave permits are required. Cave permits protect bats.

title: Hiking at Chiricahua NM
description: Heavy rains are impacting the area and creeks are flowing. Please use caution if hiking, and do not attempt to hike through flowing washes or creeks.

title: Slana Ranger Station will be open 9am - 12pm on September 12, 2022
description: If you need assistance between noon and 5pm, please call the Visitor Center in Copper Center at (907) 822-7250.

title: Face masks are required indoors.
description: Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Masks are OPTIONAL for visitors - as of August 23, 2022
description: Visitors have the option to wear a mask inside of all park buildings, effective August 23rd, 2022.

title: Cathedral Valley Roads Closed
description: The Hartnet and Cathedral/Caineville Wash Roads have been damaged by flooding and are closed on county land at the junction with State Route 24. Road repair timing by the county is unknown.

title: NPS 300 Road Conditions
description: NPS 300 to Big Tubes is currently impassable due to heavy rain. DO NOT DRIVE OFF ROAD AROUND MUDDY SPOTS. This significantly damages resources along the edge of the road and may result in a fine.

title: Face Masks Optional
description: The NPS face mask guidance is based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Face masks are currently optional at Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area, however you are welcome to wear a mask if it makes you more comfortable.

title: Stanton House Interior Closed
description: The Stanton House interior will be closed until further notice for pest removal procedures. Ranger programs will continue outdoors on the property as normal.

title: Possible Downed Trees on Park Roads and Trails
description: Due to recent heavy rainfall, there have been reports of several trails having trees fall across impeding access. We advise all visitors to be cautious for downed trees and trees at risk of falling on roads and trails.

title: Kaymoor Trail Closed between Cunard Rd Trailhead and intersection with Craig Branch Trail.
description: Recent rains have caused a trail bridge collapse on the Kaymoor Trail about 0.5 miles from the Cunard Road Trailhead. Until further notice, the Kaymoor Trail is closed from Cunard Road Trailhead to the intersection with Craig Branch Trail.

title: High River Levels
description: High water levels in all forks of the Gila River. This will affect many hiking trails. The Cliff Dwellings are open and are not affected.

title: Check in at the Visitor Center
description: All visitors must check in at the visitor center prior to hiking trails. Visitors must show America the Beautiful pass or pay fee. Rangers will provide maps, brochures, safety and educational information.

title: Roads Closed due to Flood Damage
description: CA Hwy 190 through the park has reopened. Many other roads within the park remain closed. Please stay out of closed areas so we can work safely! Click below for more info.

title: Lake Richie & Chickenbone Lake Water Warning
description: Do not drink, filter, or boil water from Lake Richie or Chickenbone Lake. Filter or boil water prior to traveling to the area. These lakes are experiencing a cyanobacteria algal bloom. It is harmful to ingest.

title: Marin Headlands - Old Springs Trail Temporary Trail Closure Starting August 30
description: Trail Crew will be replacing dilapidated boardwalks on Old Springs Trail August 30 through October 27. Signs will be posted at either end of Old Springs Trail and at the Tennessee Valley parking area. Please stay out of work zone and use alternate routes.

title: MBTA Orange Line Closure
description: Beginning Friday, Aug. 19, at 9:00pm through Sunday, Sept. 18, the entire MBTA Orange Line (from Oak Grove to Forest Hills) will be closed due to maintenance. Alternative travel options are available. Please allow for extra travel time when visiting us.

title: MBTA Orange Line Closure

title: Mask Mandate effective August 20, 2022
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of substantial or high transmission, visitors to Wind Cave National Park, regardless of vaccination status, are required to wear a mask inside all park buildings and on cave tours beginning Saturday, August 20.

title: Louisiana Circle Closed
description: Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.

title: Launch Viewing Statement Pertaining to Playalinda Beach
description: The seashore plans to remain open for Kennedy Space Center launches that are within park operating hours of 6 AM - 8 PM. Incoming traffic may close for park safety/capacity. NASA has the authority to close part of the seashore for space center operations.

title: Masks optional in park buildings
description: Masks are now optional in Morristown NHP buildings since the CDC has marked the COVID-19 Community Level for Morris County to MEDIUM as of 8/19/22. This guidance updates every week on Friday morning.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Partial Reopening 8/18/22
description: FS545/Sunset Crater Loop Road. is open. Sunset Crater Volcano is partially open with limited services. The Lava Flow and A'a trails are open. The Visitor Center, Lenox Crater and Lava's Edge Trails, as well as the Cinder Hills Overlook remain closed.

title: Portions of Visitor Center Remain Closed
description: The exhibit area and auditorium in the Visitor Center remain closed. The park store is open. All hiking & paddling trails, canoe launches, restrooms, bookstore, picnic shelter & picnic grounds remain open.

title: Masks Required in Buildings Regardless of Vaccination Status
description: COVID-19 community transmission levels for Richland County have been elevated to high. Everyone is required to wear a mask in all NPS buildings, regardless of vaccination status

title: MBTA Green Line Closure
description: Beginning Monday, August 22, through Sunday, September 18, MBTA Green Line service between Government Center and Union Square will be suspended and replaced with shuttle buses. Please allow for extra travel time when visiting us.

title: MBTA Green Line Closure
description: Beginning Monday, August 22, through Sunday, September 18, MBTA Green Line service between Government Center and Union Square will be suspended and replaced with shuttle buses. Please allow for extra travel time when visiting us.

title: High Bacteria Levels at Some Swimming Areas
description: Little Niagara is currently an area of bacterial concern. Bacteria levels at this location exceed NPS standards for recreational use. For more info, see our Bathing Beach Monitoring web page.

title: MBTA Green Line Closure
description: Beginning Monday, August 22, through Sunday, September 18, MBTA Green Line service between Government Center and Union Square will be suspended and replaced with shuttle buses. Please allow for extra travel time when visiting us.

title: Road Closures and Delays in Grandview area starting Wednesday, August 17, 2022
description: Road resurfacing work in Grandview will start on August 17, 2022 and continue for a few weeks. Turkey Spur overlook and parking lot, including Grandview Rim Trail access, will be closed. Other areas will remain open, but experience delays.

title: Road Closure at Amistad Acres
description: Due to soil and vegetation damage caused by off-road vehicle travel near Amistad Acres, undesignated dirt loop roads in the area are closed to vehicle traffic until further notice. The area will remain open to foot traffic.

title: COVID-19 Community Level: Low
description: In Hawaii County, COVID-19 community level is Low. Wearing a face mask is optional. Thank you for helping to keep yourself and others safe and healthy.

title: Equestrian Traffic Temporarily Prohibited Milepost 137.8-140.7
description: Horses are prohibited between MP 137.8 and Fifteen Mile Creek (MP 140.7) due to recent and ongoing towpath resurfacing. See more for details.

title: Miramontes Trail at Phleger Estate closed for public safety; feasibility survey in progress
description: Previous repairs have been ineffective on this creek side trail, which was damaged by a storm in 2022. The park is implementing a feasibility survey to develop a re-route on the damaged section. Until construction of a re-route, the trail will be closed.

title: COVID-19 Masking Advisory
description: Larimer, Boulder, and Grand Counties continue to switch between High, Medium, and Low community transmission levels for COVID-19. Masks are advised for Beaver Meadows VC, Moraine Park Discovery Center, Fall River VC, Alpine VC, and shuttle buses.

title: Campfire Restrictions in Place
description: Olympic National Park and Olympic National Forest implemented a campfire restriction that will only allow campfires in metal rings at designated site, campgrounds or picnic areas. This includes the coastal areas of Olympic National Park.

title: Community COVID-19 level per the CDC is Medium
description: St. Louis County is currently at a MEDIUM COVID-19 Community Transmission Level according to the CDC. Wearing a face mask inside buildings is encouraged but not required.

title: Point Supreme Overlook Closure
description: The Point Supreme Overlook and most of the parking lot are closed to all access. The area will be closed through the 2022 season.

title: Fire Restrictions
description: At Wildrose, Thorndike, and Mahogany Flats Campgrounds the setting, maintain, attending, or using of open flame of any kind is prohibited between June 15th and September 15th.

title: Balconies Caves Closed Indefinitely Due to Vandalism
description: As a result of significant resource damage in the Balconies Caves, the park has been forced to close the caves until such time as the extensive damage can be removed and repaired.

title: Face Masks are Optional at Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park
description: The COVID-19 community levels in Blanco and Gillespie Counties are currently MEDIUM. Face masks are optional.

title: Partial closure of sections of Meridian Hill Park until November 2022
description: Parts of Meridian Hill Park will be closed until November 2022 to improve accessibility and rehabilitate the historic landscape of the park.

title: Visitor Center Schedule Changes
description: The Visitor Center is closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Hours are 8:30-5:00 Sunday, Monday and Thursday - Saturday.

title: North and Northeast Entrances Closed to Visitor Vehicles, Open to Approved Commercial Tours
description: The park entrances at Gardiner, MT (North) and Cooke City/Silver Gate, MT (Northeast) are closed to visitor vehicles. These entrances are open to approved commercial tours, bicycles, and foot traffic.

title: Ancestral Chamber temporarily closed
description: Several features within the Monument’s outdoor memorial are temporarily closed due to safety concerns. The Ancestral Chamber is showing signs of stress and must be assessed prior to reopening. See https://www.nps.gov/afbg/learn/news/temp-closure-ac.htm

title: Visiting Requirements Updated August 12, 2022
description: Masks are not required for entry, but you may choose to wear one. If you have symptoms, a positive test, or exposure to someone with COVID-19 you should wear a mask.

title: Visiting Requirements Updated August 12, 2022
description: Masks are not required for entry, but you may choose to wear one. If you have symptoms, a positive test, or exposure to someone with COVID-19 you should wear a mask.

title: Road Closure
description: The northern section of Park Road between Highway 90 and VFW Road will be closed through summer of 2022. Park facilities in the Davis Bayou Area and residential homes will remain accessible during construction via a detour.

title: The George Washington Carver Museum is open by request only
description: The George Washington Carver Museum will undergo rehabilitation work beginning this Fall of 2022. Visits to the George Washington Carver Museum can be made by calling the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site.

title: WHMI Phone Lines Currently Down
description: The Whitman Mission NHS phone lines are currently down. Please use our website and social media for current park updates and information.

title: Monsoons and Park Roads
description: Monsoonal rains in the summer and early fall can be deadly. Turn around and don't drown during summer storms. Always check the weather forecast before entering the park. Dirt roads may close at no notice due to storm damage.

title: Joshua Tree Cultural Center
description: The Oasis Visitor Center moved one mile to the new interagency visitor center and cultural center at 6533 Freedom Way in Twentynine Palms. The old visitor center now serves as the headquarters and administrative office for Joshua Tree National Park.

title: Mesa Verde Closures
description: While much of the park is open, Mesa Verde has several safety and project-related closures in place, including the Mesa Top Loop, the Chapin Mesa Museum, and Spruce Tree House. Follow the link for more information.

title: Toxic Cyanobacteria in the Virgin River and the streams of Zion National Park
description: Do not submerge your head in or filter drinking water from any streams until further notice

title: Bandelier access by shuttle only 9 am to 3 pm June 4 - mid October, 2022
description: Access to Bandelier National Monument and the Frijoles Canyon Visitor Center, Pueblo Loop Trail, and Falls Trail is by shuttle bus only, June 4 - October 19, from 9am to 3pm 7 days a week.

title: Masks are currently NOT REQUIRED when visiting Tuzigoot National Monument
description: Requirements are dependent upon Community Level and based on data provided by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) for counties where the park is located. Yavapai County is currently LOW and Masks are not required inside Federal Buildings.

title: Masks are currently NOT REQUIRED when visiting Montezuma Castle and Well
description: Requirements are dependent upon Community Level and based on data provided by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) for counties where the park is located. Yavapai County is currently LOW and Masks are not required inside Federal Buildings.

title: Campfires Banned in Lake Chelan NRA and Portions of North Cascades NP
description: Campfires or the ignition of wood, briquettes, or any fuel in fire pits, fire pans, and barbeque grills, are banned in Lake Chelan National Recreation Area and the area of North Cascades National Park located in Chelan County.

title: High Clearance Vehicles Strongly Recommended for Katahdin Loop and Orin Falls Roads
description: Due to current conditions, high clearance vehicles are strongly recommended for the Katahdin Loop and Orin Falls Roads. Washboarding and protruding rocks pose risks for damage to tires and oil pans.

title: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
description: Guided tours of the Melrose mansion are available to the first ten people who sign up for each tour at the site's visitor center. Tours start at 9, 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; and masks are optional.

title: Off-Roading Vehicle Corridor
description: Portions of the ORV corridor have reopened. To see the current access map and learn more about the off-roading vehicle program, please click the link.

title: Hamilton Grange is open for limited hours
description: Beginning 5/29/2022, access to Hamilton Grange National Memorial will be increased. Hours of operation are: Friday, Saturday, Sunday 10 am - 12 pm and 1 pm - 4 pm. Instructions for reservations can be found at the link.

title: Elevator Unavailable
description: Due to repairs, the Hamilton Grange National Memorial elevator will be unavailable until further notice. Please contact hagr_info@nps.gov with questions.

title: Face masks are optional indoors
description: Masks are optional for everyone in all Point Reyes National Seashore buildings.

title: Some Roads May Impassible or Washed Out Due to Monsoon Storms
description: Due to a week of storms with more coming over the next week, many roads above 5,000 feet elevation will have deep mud and puddles that cannot be driven through. Roads in the Pakoon Basin area may be washed out as well.

title: Cyanobacteria Identified in Green River in Dinosaur National Monument
description: A recent test of an algal mat collected near the Split Mountain Campground detected potentially toxic cyanobacteria in the Green River.

title: Mask Wearing Guidance
description: In accordance with current CDC guidance, masks are not required inside federal buildings if community transmission levels are low to medium. Current Coconino County COVID transmission levels are medium.

title: Mask Wearing Guidance
description: In accordance with current CDC guidance, masks are not required inside federal buildings if community transmission levels are low to medium. Current Coconino County COVID transmission levels are medium.

title: Community COVID-19 level per the CDC is medium
description: Wearing a face mask inside is encouraged but not required.

title: Current Masking Requirements in Park Facilities
description: Based on CDC data, masks are currently required in all park facilities due to the current COVID community level being HIGH in one or more of the three Georgia/Tennessee counties in which the park has facilities.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
description: Based on updated CDC guidance regarding local COVID-19 transmission risk in Alcorn and Hardin counties, face masks are currently optional at the Corinth Civil War Interpretive Center and at the Shiloh Visitor Center. This alert will be updated as needed

title: Masks Required in Park Buildings
description: Masks are required in all NPS buildings. We continue to monitor and respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and follow CDC guidance.

title: Visitor Center Capacity Limits
description: When local and community transmission levels for COVID-19 transmission are at a high level, a capacity limit of 30 people is in place at the visitor center.

title: The Oaks, Home of Booker T. Washington is currently closed
description: The Oaks, Home of Booker T. Washington is currently closed as it undergoes rehabilitation work. The grounds are open from sunup to sundown daily.

title: Cave Tour Reservations Strongly Recommended - Walk-ups are Very Limited
description: Advance cave tour reservations are available on recreation.gov, which close at noon the day before. Reservations are the only way to ensure tickets are available for your party. Walk-up tickets are very limited and are not guaranteed.

title: Outdoor Tours and Programs Subject to Cancelation
description: Outdoor tours may be canceled due to unsafe weather conditions, including high heat or rainstorms. If you are unsure about a reserved tour, please call us at 978-970-5000.

title: Phased reopening – COVID-19 Update
description: We are working to increase access to the park in a phased approach. Masks are REQUIRED in certain areas of the park. Click the link and scroll down to read more.

title: Masks must be worn inside WNPA Park Store. Have your own mask.
description: Due to the high COVID transmission rate in Bernalillo County, all persons entering the Park Store must wear a mask. Masks are not provided. Masks are optional outside on the Information Center patio and on park trails.

title: Empire Bluff Trail Work and Closures
description: Empire Bluff Trail closures, Monday-Wednesday. 6 am-10 am Morning trail closures are to allow safe material transport along the trail. After 10am work off-trail will resume. Visitors will notice construction fencing around the parking lot.

title: Closure of Northern Section of Glenn-Kelly Road to LaFayette Road
description: On Monday, August 1, Glenn-Kelly Road, from Dyer Road to LaFayette Road, will be closed to complete the paving process of the northern section of Glenn-Kelly Road. During this closure, all public traffic use is prohibited. Tour route detours are in place.

title: Road Work Delays
description: Starting in mid-August, visitors should plan for up to 30-minute delays between mile 1.6 and 3.2 from the park entrance at US 160. Please allow extra time to reach your tour and other destinations within the park.

title: Campfire Ban
description: Craters of the Moon is currently under Stage I Fire Restrictions, which means there is high fire danger with increased probability of a quickly spreading fire. Campfires in the park including at the group campsite are prohibited.

title: Current Masking Requirements
description: If the CDC COVID-19 Community Level for Beaufort County, SC is "High", masks will be required in all park buildings. Please visit the CDC website for current Community Levels

title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) MASK Requirements
description: Monroe County, Michigan is in a current state of high transmission for the COVID-19 virus, therefore masks are required inside the visitor center, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Kaymoor Trail Closed between Wolf Creek Trailhead and Kaymoor Mine Site
description: Recent rains have caused a large mudslide across the Kaymoor Trail approximately 7/10 mile from the Wolf Creek Trailhead. Until further notice, the Kaymoor Trail is closed from Wolf Creek Trailhead on Fayette Station Road to the Kaymoor Miners Trail.

title: Memorial House Museum Open With Reduced Capacity
description: Tours of the Memorial House Museum are available Wed-Sun. Free, timed entry tickets available at the Visitor Center. Tours begin at 11:00 am and 2:30 pm. Ages six and up require tickets. Fifteen visitors will be permitted per tour.

title: Little Round Top Rehabilitation Project Closure Notice
description: The construction contractor closed Little Round Top on Tuesday, July 26. All road closures & detours have gone into effect. Little Round Top will be CLOSED for 18 months.

title: Phone System Down
description: The phones at the Andersonville National Prisoner of War Museum are down at the moment. We are sorry for the inconvenience. If you have any questions and need to contact us, please contact us via email at ande_information@nps.gov or via Facebook.

title: Use Caution on Roads with Debris
description: Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.

title: Mask wearing indoors
description: Currently, because of high COVID-19 transmission rates, the park is requiring masks in indoor areas (The park bookstore and bathrooms).
