description: Currently, because of high COVID-19 transmission rates, the park is requiring masks in indoor areas (The park bookstore and bathrooms).

title: Road Construction, Expect Delays
description: A road preservation project is now underway affecting many roads within both Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks. Please plan for delays that may last up to 30 minutes and will affect both directions of traffic.

title: Covid-19 Mask Mandate
description: In accordance with CDC guidance for counties with low to medium transmission rates, masks are optional in the visitor center and all park buildings.

title: Face Masks are Optional at Waco Mammoth National Monument
description: The COVID-19 community level in McLennan County is currently MEDIUM. Face masks are optional.

title: Fire Restrictions in Effect
description: Wood, charcoal fires, and smoking outdoors are prohibited. Gas, propane, alcohol, and tablet/cube stoves are permitted. These restrictions will be in place until rescinded.

title: Bee Alert
description: Bees are present in large numbers at the Cholla Cactus Garden, Keys View, and other areas. They are attracted to moisture. When visiting these areas, turn off vehicle AC 10 minutes before arriving so condensation can dry. Keep car windows closed.

title: All Tickets are First-Come, First Served; We Cannot Take Reservations
description: All tickets to the Truman Home and the Truman Farm Home are first-come, first-served. We cannot take reservations, except for school groups as part of a field trip. These groups are limited to 24 or less.

title: Parkway Closed Near Roanoke Due to Slope Failure
description: The Parkway is closed to all uses from Milepost 121.4 (U.S. 220) to Milepost 135.9 (Adney Gap) due to a full road failure caused by heavy rains.

title: Launch Ramp Conditions
description: Get the most current launch ramp and water elevation conditions

title: Steel Visitor Center is Closed for Construction
description: The park's primary visitor center at park headquarters and the restrooms are closed in 2022. Visit the temporary visitor center, park store, and restrooms in Mazama Village or Rim Visitor Center, 9 am to 5 pm daily. Vault toilets are at most picnic areas.

title: Use Caution on Roads with Debris
description: Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.

title: Construction Work in Visitor Center
description: 7/25 - 9/1: Installation of a new fire suppression system in the Wupatki Visitor Center could cause noise and dust. Portions of the VC or bookstore may be closed to include interior restrooms. Portable toilets are available in the parking lot.

title: Face masks status update
description: Face masks are optional at Fort Vancouver NHS in Vancouver, WA, and at the McLoughlin House Unit in Oregon City, Oregon.

title: Walking Bridge Over the Falls CLOSED
description: Due to safety concerns the footbridge crossing the Passaic River is indefinitely closed. To access Mary Ellen Kramer Park foot traffic may use the Wayne Ave. Bridge; caution is advised due to construction. Maple St. parking is limited due to construction.

title: Intermittent Maple St. Closure/Vehicle Access Reduction
description: City construction requires short-notice, frequent closure of Maple St. projected through August. Vehicle access to Mary Ellen Kramer Park/Waterfall Overlook is limited. The construction on the Wayne Ave. Bridge heavily restricts accessibility.

title: Masks Required
description: COVID-19 community levels are high in Frederick and surrounding counties in Virginia. Face masks are required in National Park Service buildings.

title: General Store Hours
description: General Store hours are currently 9 a.m. – 6 p.m. The public laundry facility is open 9 a.m. - 6 p.m. and the restrooms and showers located at the General Store are open 9 a.m. - 8 p.m. Shower tokens can be purchased in the General Store or Bryce Lodge.

title: County Lane 6N Construction Closures
description: County Lane 6N, one of two main routes to the Great Sand Dunes National Park entrance, is closed over two phases of road construction from June 6 through September.

title: Turkey Creek Bridge Closed
description: The iron bridge over Turkey Creek between the Kirby and Sandhill Loop trails is closed for repairs. Kirby and Sandhill are open but not connected at this time. The Turkey Creek Trail is open between FM 1943 and Sandhill Loop.

title: Use Caution with GPS Navigation
description: The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.

title: Repaving construction at Main Entrance Station in Homestead
description: Construction at the Main Entrance Station. Outbound (Exit) lane speed limit has been reduced to 15 mph. Visitors should watch for lane changes associated with the construction. Drive carefully and observe posted signs and directional markers.

title: Masks Required in Port Alsworth Visitor Center
description: Following CDC guidance to reduce the spread of COVID-19, and due to Lake and Peninsula Borough community spread being HIGH, masks are required for all staff and visitors in buildings, including the Port Alsworth Visitor Center.

title: Fire Restrictions at Devils Tower National Monument
description: In accordance with restrictions instituted by the Crook County Commission, no setting, building, maintaining, or using open fires of any kind in the monument. This includes campfires and charcoal fires at the Belle Fourche Campground and the picnic area.

title: Masks Required to Enter Visitor Center
description: Due to High Covid-19 Community Levels masks are required to enter all Federal Buildings at this time.

title: Masks Required to Enter Albert Gallatin Home
description: Due to High Covid-19 Community Levels masks are required to enter all Federal Buildings at this time.

title: No Drinking Water Or Restrooms Near Sandburg Home Or Barn
description: Due to water system issues, there is no drinking water or restrooms near the house or barn. Bring your own drinking water. Portable toilets are open.

title: Bears Activity in the Park
description: Please be "bear aware" when using park trails. Give bears plenty of space, make noise on the trail, keep children close and pets on leash.

title: Devil's Den Closure Rehabilitation Project
description: Devil’s Den closed for rehabilitation work on Monday, March 21. This project will address significant erosion and safety issues in this highly visited area of the battlefield. Devil’s Den will be CLOSED for approximately six months.

title: Zollicoffer Park Trail Closure
description: Due to danger of falling limbs, the wooded trail at Zollicoffer Park is closed until further notice. Zollicoffer Park itself will remain open to view the grave markers, monuments, and non-wooded parts of the trail. Contact Visitor Center for more info.

title: Your GPS May Be Wrong
description: There are five entrances to the park. GPS may take you to the wrong entrance or attempt to follow the most direct route, which could lead to closed gates. It can take hours to reroute to the correct entrance. Check directions & maps, not just your GPS.

title: The Mansion is Not Air-Conditioned
description: Be advised, due to excessive heat, there may be limited access to the Mansion.

title: Oasis Visitor Center Hours Change
description: The Oasis Visitor Center is now open Tuesday-Saturday from 9:00am-4:30pm. It will be closed Sunday-Monday. The bathrooms will remain open seven days a week.

title: Restaurant Open 12pm-7pm.
description: The Chisos Mountains Lodge restaurant is currently open from 12 PM to 7 PM. Limited indoor seating. Take-out meals available. Please call 432-477-2291 for more details.

title: Dingmans Falls Trail Closure
description: Starting July 18, the Dingmans Falls trail will be closed weekdays for routine maintenance and necessary repairs. There is an alternate route located behind the visitor center building. This alternate route is not wheelchair accessible.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: 2022 Fire Restrictions Beginning 07/22/2022
description: All fires at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area are prohibited effective 12:01 am, Friday, July 22, 2022, until further notice.

title: Park Phone System Technical Difficulties
description: The park phone system is experiencing technical difficulties. If you need to reach us by phone and are unable to get through, please e-mail fopu_information@nps.gov. We'll respond as soon as possible. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

title: Camp only in campgrounds
description: South, Watchman, and Lava Point Campgrounds are open for the season. If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.

title: Carriage Road near Cliffside Bridge Closes to Horses Aug 1
description: Starting Aug 1, a section of carriage road between intersection 14 and 21 will be closed to horses to repair the Cliffside Bridge. The use of large machinery will make the area unsafe for horses and riders.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
description: Wearing a mask is currently required inside all park buildings. In areas the CDC identifies as high COVID-19 community level, masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings regardless of vaccination status.

title: Partial Closure of the Rim Trail
description: As a result of a repaving project, the Rim Trail is currently partially closed. The closure is from the junction point to the second overlook. The first viewpoint and access to the partially rebuilt pueblo and pit house remain open.

title: Fire rings at Ocean Beach (FIRES ONLY PERMITTED IN OFFICIAL RINGS)
description: Fire rings provided at Ocean Beach. Fires are ONLY allowed between 6AM-9:30PM in the 16 fire rings between Stairwells 15-20. They are available to visitors for free on a first-come, first-served basis. See fire regulations link for details.

title: Face Masks Required in All National Park Service Buildings
description: Face masks are currently required in all NPS buildings throughout the park regardless of vaccination status.

title: 2022 Tour Season Schedule
description: Cave tours are offered daily 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM through Labor Day. Then Thursday thru Monday until the first Sunday of November. Due to Covid-19 tours might be limited. Contact our Illinois Valley Visitor Center at 541-592-5125 for current information.

title: The Point Campground to close for road work Nov. 1, 2022 to Jan. 31, 2023
description: The Point Campground will close for road work on November 1, 2022. Work is expected to take until the end of January. If work is completed early, the campground will reopen at that time.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Masks are required for everyone in all park buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Highway 14 Road Construction
description: Road construction along Highway 14 from Cedar City to the park and Highway 89 to the park is causing 30-45 minute delays during daylight hours, please plan accordingly.

title: Mask Mandate in Effect
description: Due to current, high COVID-19 community levels, mask wearing is required for all people when entering federal buildings, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Apollo Beach Parking Area 1A Temporary Closure
description: Apollo Beach boardwalk 1A, located in the northern half of parking area number one, is temporarily closed. Maintenance will then begin replacing the boardwalk.

title: Re-opening of St. Paul's Church & museum for tours
description: Visitors can once again enjoy tours of both the museum and the historic church at St. Paul's. Reservations are required, through: https://www.recreation.gov. See the Calendar on this website for details.

title: COVID-19 Mask Update
description: Masks required indoors in Los Angeles and Ventura County. This includes Santa Monica Mountains Visitor Center at King Gillette Ranch (Calabasas) and Satwiwa Native American Indian Culture Center (Newbury Park).

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Due to increased levels of transmission, the CDC has recently raised the COVID-19 Community Levels for Jackson County to “High”. Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings regardless of vaccination status.

title: Raptor Nest Climbing Closures in Effect
description: Beginning Jan. 18th 2022, many climbing routes (especially in the Balconies area) are under a closure. Read more about it here. https://www.nps.gov/pinn/planyourvisit/advisory.htm

title: Reroofing construction project at Royal Palm
description: Anhinga Trail, Gumbo Limbo Trail, and restrooms remain open. The Royal Palm gift store and east side of the main parking lot are closed for construction. Please use the west side of main parking and auxillary parking during your visit.

title: Check for Road Closures
description: Road maintenance work may cause temporary closures of sections of the parkway this summer and fall. For road status updates, please check the Road and Facility Closures page.

title: Piney Branch Parkway Closure
description: Piney Branch Parkway NW is temporarily closed to all traffic (pedestrian, bicycle and vehicular) to allow work to be done on the Rock Creek Multi-Use trail in this area. The project should be completed in the Fall of 2022.

title: CLOSURE: Public Restrooms at the Orangery
description: The park's public restrooms (in the Orangery) are closed for a sidewalk replacement project. Parking in the upper lot is also limited. Visitors may use restrooms at the visitor center (mansion side) and dovecote (farm side).

title: Construction Closures at Overlooks (Summer 2022)
description: There are a number of construction projects occurring throughout the park this summer. Overlook closures and dates are listed in the Current Conditions page on this site. Some delays can be expected. Please drive safely.

title: Visitor Center Hours
description: The Visitor Center area is open from 9am until 5pm. The Visitor Center, Petrified Forest loop, Ponderosa loop, and parking lot close promptly at 5pm. Remaining vehicles subject to $180 fine.

title: Monsoon Season & Flash Floods
description: Heavy rains can cause sudden flooding, especially in canyons and washes. Do not drive or hike through flood waters. Get to high ground and wait for floods to subside. Some roads may close temporarily; closures are posted at the visitor center.

title: Beech Forest Trail Boardwalk Replacement
description: The Beech Forest Trail in Provincetown is undergoing replacement of its elevated boardwalk beginning 7/11. During these repairs, a 0.5 mile portion of the trail will be inaccessible to visitors. The project is expected to last up to eight weeks.

title: Free Skating Rentals Open 9am-5pm
description: Anacostia Park Skating Rentals at the Skating Pavilion is open 9am-5pm everyday. Skate Rentals are free. Please bring a valid government ID and socks to rent skates.

title: Flooding in Fort Massachusetts
description: Fort Massachusetts has been experiencing periodic flooding due to recent rain storms, causing park staff to close the fort for periods of time until the water recedes. Park staff will assess fort conditions daily and open the fort when conditions allow.

title: El Malpais Visitor Center Closed Tuesdays & Wednesdays
description: The El Malpais Visitor Center is currently closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays until further notice. No parking or restrooms are available at the visitor center while it is closed. The rest of the park is open to visit when the visitor center is closed.

title: Visitor Center and Information Kiosk Hours
description: The Harry Hampton Visitor Center and Information Kiosk is CLOSED daily from 12:00 - 1:00 p.m.

title: Devils Tower is a Cashless Entry Park
description: As of April 1st, 2022, Devils Tower National Monument accepts entrance fee payments via card and digital payments only. Reducing cash collected in fee operations allows a park unit to be a better steward of our visitor’s dollars.

title: Port Alsworth Visitor Center hours 10am-5:30pm
description: Effective Sunday, July 10th, the Port Alsworth Visitor Center will be open from 10am-5:30pm daily. Outdoor exhibits are available 24/7.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirements City Point Level Medium
description: Grant’s Headquarters (Hopewell City): Masking guidance aligns with the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Level tool. Current level: Medium. Follow recommendations from your healthcare provider. Individuals are welcome to wear a mask at any time.

title: Face Masks Are Optional
description: Face masks are currently optional in all buildings at Minuteman Missile NHS.

title: Electric Vehicle Charging
description: While the campgrounds at Gulf Islands have sites equipped with electricity, our systems do not currently support the charging of electric vehicles.

title: Timed Entry Reservation Pilot
description: To enter the park from April 3 to October 3, 2022, visitors need a Timed Entry Ticket. We encourage you to reserve yours on Recreation.gov up to three months prior to visiting. Extra tickets become available for day-before purchase.

title: Visitor Center Phones Down
description: Phones at the Selma Interpretive Center and the Lowndes Interpretive Center are currently down. Please call the Montgomery Interpretive Center at (334)293-0597 for questions or to make a reservation for a group visit at any of our visitor centers.

title: Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail Visitor Hours Update
description: The Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail hours have changed. All three Interpretive Centers are open Wednesday - Saturday from 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. (CST).

title: Plains Depot Platform Closed for Renovations
description: The Plains Depot platform will be closed starting Monday, July 11. The lower part of Plains Depot, accessed through the glass door, will be open.

title: Eastern National Bookstore Re-Opens at the Selma Interpretive Center
description: The Eastern National bookstore/gift shop at the Selma Interpretive Center is open Sunday - Saturday from 9:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.(CST).

title: COVID-19 Response
description: Due to high community levels in Ventura County, masks are required (regardless of vaccination status) indoors at our mainland and island visitor centers and indoors on public transportation provider Island Packers.

title: Schoolhouse Ridge South parking lot closed on weekends
description: Due to ongoing safety issues, the Schoolhouse Ridge South parking lot is currently closed on weekends.

title: Fire Restrictions in Effect for Wrangell-St. Elias National Park and Preserve
description: In response to the current high fire danger, effective immediately and until further notice, open campfires are restricted to designated campgrounds or cabins within enclosed metal fire grates or designated fire rings provided at those park sites.

title: Caution - Construction Zone
description: Please use caution and follow signs as you enter the parking lot. Follow signs to reach the historic ranch site. A 10 minute film is inside the barn. Please use caution and be safe.

title: Covid-19 Response
description: Federal guidelines require masks be worn inside the Whitman Mission National Historic Site Visitor Center while the CDCs COVID-19 Community Level tool shows "High" in Walla Walla County. Check the tool on Fridays to see updates

title: Most areas of the park are open, but there are a few closures currently in effect.
description: Current closures may affect visits to Kule Loklo and Point Reyes Beach. Kite flying and kiteboarding are prohibited at Abbotts Lagoon and along sections of the Point Reyes Beach and Limantour Beach.

title: Masks Required in all Park Buildings
description: As of July 1st, 2022; Per President's Executive Order 13991, agencies have been instructed to follow CDC guidance in their local county as it pertains to the spread of COVID-19. Due to high transmission levels, masks are required inside park buildings.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings regardless of vaccination status. For more information go to the link below.

title: Black Canyon South Rim Wilderness Permits
description: Summer 2022: South Rim inner canyon permits will ONLY be available from a ranger at the South Rim Visitor Center. Meet for orientation at 3:30pm the day BEFORE your trip. Permits are required for Gunnison, Tomichi, and Warner routes; daily limits apply.

title: Quarry Tours will only be offered at 10:00 a.m. during the months of July and August.
description: Quarry Tours will only be offered at 10:00 a.m. during the months of July and August.

title: Social Trail to Shoreline Closed
description: The social trail to the right of the bulkhead at Kingsley Plantation will be closed with a fence starting July 7, 2022. Erosion issues there threaten both the bulkhead structure and safety. Please use the access off the path toward the dock for fishing.

title: US Highway 50 Roadwork
description: Road construction with delays and nightly closures is taking place on US Highway 50 between Cimarron and the junction of Colorado Highway 92. The road is open to two way traffic on weekends and holidays. Daily closures end July 1 at Noon.

title: Fire Restrictions in Effect
description: Due to high fire danger, all campfires/charcoal grill are prohibited. Gas or propane stove/grills are allowed.

title: Tour Road, Visitor Center, and Restrooms are Open
description: The Visitor Center is open 8:30 am to 4:30 pm daily. The tour road is open from 8 am to 5 pm with last entry at 4:40 pm daily. Restrooms are open. Park grounds are open sunrise to sunset daily.

title: Avoid flash floods
description: Flash floods are a sudden increase in the depth and speed of water in rivers, streams, or washes due to rain. Flood waters carry large debris like tree trunks and boulders and can happen at any time in Zion National Park.

title: William Floyd Estate
description: The Old Mastic House is closed for renovations until further notice. The grounds are open to daily visitation.

title: Se requiere cubrebocas en instlaciones del parque
description: Acorde con los lineamientos del CDC respecto a zonas de alta transmisión, los visitantes deben usar cubrebocas dentro de todas las instalaciones del parque sin importar su estado de vacunación.

title: Ferry Schedule
description: The ferry service to the fort is closed on Monday & Tuesday. Trips to Fort Matanzas are operating Wednesday-Sunday only. Boarding passes are required. However the visitor center and surrounding grounds remain open seven days a week.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of substantial or high transmission, visitors to Chamizal National Memorial, regardless of vaccination status, are required to wear a mask inside all park buildings.

title: Fire Restrictions in Place HIGH, Beginning May 27
description: Wood and charcoal fires not permitted, propane and gas stoves only. No smoking is allowed on trails. Please monitor this website and the park social media pages for the most up to date information as conditions can change rapidly.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: As of June 27, 2022 masks are required for everyone in all park buildings, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Face coverings required
description: Beginning June 28, 2022, face coverings are required in the Visitor Center, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Restroom Closure on 5th Street
description: The restroom facility at 5th and Chestnut Streets is closed. Please use the restrooms in the Independence Visitor Center at 6th and Market Streets.

title: Habituated Bears by Holgate Cabin
description: A pair of habituated Black Bears were observed on Holgate Beach. Habituated bears show no fear of human presence and often do not respond to auditory hazing. Review bear safety information before visiting coastal areas and help us keep wild bears wild.

title: Ruby Beach Closed through mid September
description: The Ruby Beach entrance road, parking area, and beach access trail is closed to all public access for construction activities. No pedestrian access is allowed through the construction site. Roadside parking along Highway 101 in the vicinity is prohibited.

title: COVID-19 Temporary Operations [Masks required in buildings]
description: Masks are currently required in buildings when San Benito County is at a HIGH level of transmission. This change to operations is part of the effort to slow the spread of COVID-19. Learn what else is currently open and closed at Pinnacles National Park.

title: Difficult conditions complicate Cataract Canyon takeouts
description: Hite Ramp is closed. The North Wash take-out is a primitive, unimproved dirt take-out. You will not be able to back a trailer down the dirt slope. Recent washouts have further deteriorated conditions.

title: Yellow Jackets at Scorpion Anchorage and Prisoners Harbor
description: Yellow jackets are active on Santa Cruz Island. Keep your food covered, avoid waving your arms and back away slowly instead, and persons sensitive to yellow jacket venom should carry a sting treatment kit or visit another location.

title: Summer 2022 Tours of Boyhood Home and Texas White House Grounds
description: During times of extreme heat, tours of the Boyhood Home and Texas White House Grounds may be suspended to ensure the safety of visitors and staff. Please check-in at the Visitor Centers for daily tour availability.

title: Face masks are required indoors
description: Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Face masks are optional indoors
description: Masks are optional for everyone in all NPS buildings and enclosed public transportation, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Gastrointestinal Illness Reported Recently in Grand Canyon's Backcountry
description: Prevent illness by proper hand washing and ensure the safety of your drinking water.

title: Special Use Permits
description: Special Use Permits are typically needed for activities that benefit a specific group. Examples include: trips organized by scouting groups, churches, or academic institutions, photography, weddings, and first amendment activities.

title: Appropriate Footwear Required for Cave Tours
description: Visitors are required to wear completely enclosed shoes if participating in a cave tour, like tennis shoes, sneakers or hiking boots. Any type of sandals or shoes with any openings are NOT acceptable.

title: Road Construction on Upper Hoh Road outside the park
description: Visitors to Hoh Rain Forest: Expect delays up to 30 minutes total through the work zone on weekdays from 8am-5pm. Drive with caution and expect flaggers and heavy truck traffic.

title: Expect delays at Hoh Rain Forest entrance station due to heavy summer visitation
description: The parking lot at the Hoh Rain Forest can fill early. The busiest time is 10am to 3pm. Arrive early or later in the day to avoid traffic congestion. Park in designated spaces only.

title: Grand Canyon National Park implements Tuweep pilot day-use reservation system
description: This pilot reservation program does not apply to Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument. This is for the Tuweep area of the national park, which includes Toroweap Overlook and the Kanab Plateau which is east of the monument boundary.

title: Walking Path Caved In
description: A small part of the walking path near the monument at Fort Christina has caved in. For your safety, the area surrounding the monument has been coned off until the path can be stabilized. Please do not walk within the coned off area.

title: COVID-19 Mask Guidance
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of medium and low transmission, visitors to Golden Spike National Historical Park have the option wearing a mask inside all park buildings.

title: Backcountry Camping & Tall Trees Permits Are Online
description: Permits for backcountry camping or hiking Tall Trees Grove are not being issued at our visitor centers. These free permits must be applied for online.

title: Covid Status
description: Find out what are the conditions across the Park, campgrounds, and within our visitor centers. Our state and federal response is driven by what is happening in Del Norte and Humboldt Counties. We follow county and state health response guidelines.

title: Top Ten Travel Tips: Plan Like A Park Ranger
description: To have the best experience here, we recommend you "Plan Like A Park Ranger". Most of the Park is open without the need for permits, but planning ahead will avoid surprises. Our rangers give you their best tips for a busy summer.

title: Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike
description: The hike to Devil's Hall is now rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks, and may be unstable.

title: Williams Ranch Road Closed
description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to extensive damage.

title: Credit Card Only
description: Entrance fee and pass purchases will need to be made with a credit or debit card. The monument will not be processing cash transactions. Apple, Google, and Samsung Pay are accepted.

title: Arizona / Utah Time Change Warning
description: Utah observes Daylight Saving Time while Arizona does not. This creates a one hour time difference between the states. Please take this into consideration while traveling to Pipe Spring National Monument from Utah.

title: Eastern National Bookstore Remains Closed
description: The Eastern National Bookstore located at Martin Van Buren NHS remains closed at this time.

title: Ranger Talks Temporarily Suspended
description: Ranger talks at Sand Creek Massacre NHS have resumed. The site is open Thursday - Monday from 9am to 4pm and talk take place at 10am and 2pm.

title: Park Store Operations
description: The WNPA Park Store is open inside the Visitor Contact Station at the historic site outside of Eads. The occupancy limit is 4 people at a time. Masks are optional.
